stadium.name: Fletchings Field
stadium.description: Fletchings Field was the first formal Troll Ball stadium in Warden lands. The design balances wood and stone, with arrowhead motifs and banners representing each region under Warden protection. The field includes trees, gully's and other obstacle placements, changed each match by local druids and terrain crafters.

stats.pregame_ritual: Going over the game plan drawn in the dirt with the team captain.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Giving the Trollball a heroic backstory before each game.
Headbutting their own team's goal post (gently).
Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Burying their helmet in the ground and then digging it back up.
Reading their own fortune in a scattering of knuckle bones.
Wearing a specific, garishly colored pair of undergarments.
Always putting on their left gauntlet before their right.

stadium.name: The High-Pass Pitch
stadium.description: A field built at a breathtaking altitude in a fortified mountain pass. The air is painfully thin, and the weather is dangerously unpredictable.

stats.pregame_ritual: Tying a small, hand-carved wooden bird to their gear.
Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Avoiding eye contact with anyone wearing the color green.
Sharing a ceremonial, non-alcoholic grog from a communal cup.
Whispering a secret fear to the Trollball before the game.
Reciting their grocery list backward to clear their mind.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Asking a teammate to tell them a story, but only the beginning.
Exchanging well-wishes with their direct opponent before the game starts.
Singing a sea shanty completely out of tune.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Avoiding eye contact with anyone wearing the color green.

preGame:
üéôÔ∏è STEP RIGHT UP, SPORTS FANS! IT‚ÄôS A GRAND DAY FOR A GRUDGE MATCH! üéôÔ∏è Well hello, Osterra! This is Nok the Corrupter, coming to you live from Fletchings Field for Game 2 of this Winners Bracket showdown! The air is thick with the scent of pine and impending peril, and boy-oh-boy, is the atmosphere electric! We‚Äôre deep in the playoffs now, and the stakes are higher than a Fey on a bender! Oak & Onslaught is currently sitting pretty with a 1-0 lead in this Best of 5 series, and the local Warden fans are out in droves, cheering for their boys like they‚Äôve never seen a good old-fashioned demonic summoning before! üå≥üí•

I just saw Teria Ravo over by the goal posts, giving them a gentle headbutt to get her mind right‚Äînow that‚Äôs what I call using your noggin! And keep an eye on Abner Seidel, folks; my scouts tell me he‚Äôs got those garishly colored undergarments on today, so you know he‚Äôs feeling lucky! On the other side of the pitch, the Oread's Summit Tamers are looking to climb back into this series. Alwyn Wandy was seen whispering a secret fear to the Trollball. I hope that fear wasn't 'getting hit by a mace,' because Wynnie Faina looks like he‚Äôs ready to swing for the fences! ‚öæüõ°Ô∏è

This field is a real piece of work, too! The local druids have been messing with the dirt, so expect the terrain to shift more than a politician‚Äôs promises. Between the Warden‚Äôs Watch keeping a literal eye on the proceedings and the natural obstacles, these Tamers are going to have a tough time finding their footing. It‚Äôs a battle of the mountain against the woods, and while I‚Äôd personally rather be watching the Ebon Gate Corruptors stomp some sense into those Haven Lights, this playoff action is the next best thing to a prison break! Let‚Äôs get that ball in play and some teeth on the grass! ü¶∑üèüÔ∏è
postGame:
### üèüÔ∏è AN ONSLAUGHT INDEED! OAK & ONSLAUGHT SHUT OUT THE TAMERS! üèüÔ∏è

Well, pull my horns and call me a goat, what a defensive masterclass! Oak & Onslaught has absolutely dismantled the Oread's Summit Tamers with a 4-0 victory, putting them up 2-0 in this Best of 5 series! The Tamers looked like they were trying to navigate a maze while wearing blindfolds, and the Wardens were more than happy to lead them straight into a brick wall! From the very first whistle, it was clear that the home field advantage at Fletchings Field was no joke, with the shifting terrain leaving the visitors stumbling like a bunch of adventurers who‚Äôve had too much of Imra‚Äôs elixirs! üå≤‚ú®

Affra Yanaton set the tone early, snatching up that Trollball in Center Field and making Clippard Burr look like she was standing still! Hole Bowerman was right there with her, charging toward the goal like a runaway stagecoach. Though Wynnie Faina missed an early shot, the pressure was relentless. It wasn't long before the highlight of the first half occurred‚ÄîAbner Seidel, probably powered by those lucky garish bloomers, launched a magnificent 2-point shot from the Away 2-Point zone that sailed through the hoops as clean as a whistle! üéØüí®

But the real story of the game was the brutality, folks! Normi Glaudia decided that Odericus Juxon didn't need to be standing anymore, delivering a tackle so crisp you could hear the armor buckle from the top row! Juxon was sent straight to Carn Tibbetts for some emergency stitching. Not to be outdone, Ema Ulrick followed up by flattening Mitran Mariand. The Tamers tried to mount a comeback, but even when Zadoc Wyatan found an opening, his pass was snatched out of the air by the ever-present Wynnie Faina! It was a total breakdown in communication for the mountain crew! üè•ü¶¥

As we hit halftime, the score was 2-0, and the Tamers looked like they needed more than a grocery list recited backward to fix their problems. The Warden defenders were playing like Sir Randy himself was watching from the trees with that fancy, over-designed bow of his! Ahron Latashia had her work cut out for her keeping the Onslaught squad in peak killing condition, but she did a bang-up job as they came out for the second half looking even hungrier! ü•ó‚öîÔ∏è

The second half was a literal graveyard for the Tamers' hopes. Affra Yanaton decided she wasn't done, absolutely leveling Edme Virgil and sending them to the healer's tent. Before the dust could even settle, Normi Glaudia was at it again, delivering a crunching blow to Dric Trilley that had the crowd roaring! It‚Äôs the kind of violence that makes a demon‚Äôs heart skip a beat‚Äîpure, unadulterated Trollball magic! üíñüî®

The Tamers were dropping the ball left and right‚Äîliterally! Kass Fogel tried a pass to herself that ended up on the grass, and the Wardens were there to pounce on it every single time. It was a comedy of errors for the Prismatic Troups' favorites. I haven't seen this much confusion since Falric tried to balance his checkbook! The defensive line for Oak & Onslaught was an impenetrable thicket of shields and lances! üõ°Ô∏èü§°

Midway through the half, Abner Seidel proved he‚Äôs more than just a shooter, taking out Mitran Mariand for the second time today! Five injuries in one game, folks! That‚Äôs what we call a full house in the medical tent! The Tamers were playing short-handed and short-breathed, and you could see the frustration mounting on the face of Swamy Ahasuerus as her tackles kept finding nothing but thin air! üå¨Ô∏èü•ä

Millham Evangeline added one more to the tally, sending Zadoc Wyatan to the dirt with a tackle that echoed through the gully. With the Tamers' offense completely neutralized, Affra Yanaton decided to put the final nail in the coffin. She lined up a shot from Center Field and nailed it, bringing the score to a commanding 4-0! It was the exclamation point on a game that was never really in doubt! üìçüí•

As the final whistle blew, the scoreboard told the whole story: a big fat zero for the mountain Tamers and a glorious four for the forest-dwelling Wardens. The Tamers' fans‚Äîwho I‚Äôm told consist mainly of a few confused mountain goats‚Äîhad nothing to cheer for. Meanwhile, the Oak & Onslaught faithful are already starting the victory chants! They are just one win away from a sweep in this series! üßπüèÜ

The series now heads toward Game 3, and the Oread's Summit Tamers are going to need a miracle‚Äîor maybe a better favorite weapon than a dirk‚Äîif they want to stay alive in the Winners Bracket. If they don't find a way to stop Yanaton and Seidel, they‚Äôll be heading to the Losers Bracket faster than a rogue escaping a circus! üé™üèÉ

This is Nok the Corrupter, signing off from a very lopsided, very bloody, and very entertaining day at Fletchings Field! Remember, in the Everwar, you might come back to life, but you never get back the pride you lost on the Trollball pitch! Stay nasty, Osterra! üåôüëø
